com.rodolk.numserver.loggingprotocol

Class ApplicationProtocol

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rodolk.numserver.loggingprotocol.ApplicationProtocol

  • public class ApplicationProtocol
extends java.lang.Object
    ApplicationProtocol manages the defined application protocol for a single connection. Each connection must have one instance of ApplciationProtocol. The main method is execute() and it will run through different until it is indicated to terminate by another object. It can also terminate through a ProtocolException:
    • For connection closed (ProtocolException.ErrorCode.CLOSED)
    • For 'terminate' indicated by client (ProtocolException.ErrorCode.END)
    • For error in input data or other socket error

    In order for the read data to be processed a DataConsumer must be subscribed with dataConsumerSubscribe

    This class implements a state pattern where every state inherits from State.
